meanings.definition: To make or become red in color.
meanings.sent1: After playing outside in the sun all day, her cheeks reddened from the heat.
meanings.sent2: The painter reddened the walls with a vibrant shade of crimson.
meanings.sent3: The apple reddened with embarrassment after falling off the tree in front of the other fruits.
meanings.sent4: The sky reddened as the sun began to set, painting the clouds a fiery orange.
meanings.sent5: The spicy chili sauce reddened his lips and made his eyes water.

meanings.sent1: The artist reddened the cheeks of the portrait to give it a rosy glow.
meanings.sent2: The cold wind reddened her nose and ears as she walked home.
meanings.sent3: The magician's trick unexpectedly reddened the rabbit's fur, leaving the audience in awe.
meanings.sent4: The fire alarm reddened the faces of the students who had been caught skipping class.
meanings.sent5: The dye reddened the fabric, transforming it from white to a deep shade of scarlet.

meanings.definition: To blush or flush with embarrassment or emotion.
meanings.sent1: She reddened with embarrassment when her crush caught her staring.
meanings.sent2: His cheeks reddened with anger as he listened to the unfair accusations.
meanings.sent3: The puppy reddened with excitement when it saw its favorite toy.
meanings.sent4: The bride reddened with joy as she walked down the aisle to her waiting groom.
meanings.sent5: The child's face reddened with pride as they received a gold star for their hard work.
